awd_titl_txt: East-Coast Regional Workshop on Architectural Research Needsin Earthquake Hazard Mitigation
awd_abstract_narration: This project will organize, convene and report                                  on an NSF regionally-based workshop on                                          architectural research needs in earthquake                                      hazard mitigation.  The workshop will review                                    and analyze the current state-of-the-art in                                     relation to a range of earthquake hazard                                        mitigation in architectural and nonstructural                                   systems, and in relation to broader land-use                                    planning issues and physical urban design                                       issues.  Future research needs will be identified                               and prioritized for these same systems under                                    the goals of the Architectural and Mechanical                                   Systems (AMS) program element.  As one of                                       three regional workshops on the topic subject,                                  this workshop will focus on East-Coast issues.                                                                                                                  A Final Report on Workshop results will be                                      issued for distribution to the architectural and                                urban design research community and for NSF                                     use in program development.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE
